p: Sr 0.9Ba 0.1Co 0.95Ru 0.05O 3−δ perovskite was obtained as a polycrystalline powder. The XRD diffractogram ( Figure 1) collected with Cu Kα radiation evidenced the presence of the perovskite cubic phase. In a first approach, the crystal structure was refined on the basis of a simple cubic aristotype defined in the standard perovskite model at Pm-3m space group, with unit-cell parameter of a = 3.9159(5) Å. This is considerably expanded with respect to that corresponding to the parent compound of 3.858(1) Å [ 14], as expected for the much bigger size of Ba 2+ (1.61 Å) with respect to Sr 2+ (1.44 Å) ions in twelvefold coordination [ 16].
